pages.content:
[HEADING] Finance
[HEADING] Discover the tracks of the Master's Finance
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Start your career in finance with the Master's Finance at the Amsterdam Business School. This programme will provide a deep understanding of financial markets and decision-making. We will train you in a broad range of quantitative and soft skills to take to your first employer. The goal is to foster teaching innovation and capitalise on comparative advantages. Choose one of our tracks and focus on the field that interests you most.
In this Master's programme, you must complete one of the tracks alongside several general courses. Each track is structured around a distinct career path in finance. It provides the skills and knowledge that you need to excel in that path. The specialised courses offer a small-scale learning environment with a familiar cohort of classmates.
Lychelle did the Master's programme Corporate Finance. Now she's Teamlead of Accounting Operations at Adyen. How did she experience the transition to the labor market?
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• Asset management (or investment management) studies portfolios of assets, typically including stocks, bonds and cash, for individuals or companies.          




More about the track
• With the Banking and Regulation track you study how banks make lending and investment decisions, and the broad challenge of managing macroeconomic risk through regulation and supervision of banks.          




More about the track
• Do you have a sharp mind? A fascination with numbers and governance? Want to work with a bank or a consultancy firm? Then this may be your track within the Master's Finance.          




More about the track
• Discover the Quantitative Finance track in our Master's in Finance. Learn to model security prices, design investment strategies, and master data analytics for risk management.          




More about the track
• The Real Estate Finance track provides you with an in-depth understanding of real estate markets and valuation in the context of international finance.          




More about the track
• The Finance and Real Estate Finance Combination Track is for ambitious students that seek to combine specialist knowledge in real estate finance with a broader understanding of other concepts in finance.          




More about the track

pages.title: Doing a Master's - University of Amsterdam

pages.content:
[HEADING] Business Economics
[HEADING] Discover the tracks of the Master's Business Economics
[HEADING] Pre-Master’s Programme
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Our 1-year academic Master’s programme in Business Economics teaches you to conduct research in business economics subjects. Choose from our top-level tracks: Managerial Economics and Strategy, Sustainability or Neuroeconomics.
The Master's in Business Economics gives you the opportunity to specialise in your field of interest, by choosing one of our challenging tracks. All tracks are a combination of general courses and track-specific courses.
The pre-Master's programme is designed to complement your prior education. It will help you to fully catch up on subjects such as econometrics, microeconomics and macroeconomics. Within 1 academic year you will have all the necessary knowledge and skills to start your Master’s in Business Economics.
Who can give you the best information about what it is like to study Business Economics at the University of Amsterdam? Our students of course. Antonio Trucillo will tell you all about it.
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• The Managerial Economics and Strategy track teaches you how to make the right organisational and financial decisions for organisations.          




More about the track
• In the Neuroeconomics track you learn to understand the brain’s role in controlling human behaviour.          




More about the track
• In the Sustainability track of the Master's Business Economics, you will learn evidence-based economic policies and business strategies that achieve sustainability in practice.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Accountancy and Control
[HEADING] Discover the tracks of the Master's Accountancy and Control
[HEADING] Pre-Master’s programme
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Our 1-year Master's Accountancy and Control prepares you for a career in accountancy or financial management. The programme offers you a challenging combination of academic training and the practical application of accounting and financial management related topics. These topics range from international financial and reporting standards (IFRS), to complex real-life business cases. You will develop your intellectual skills, professional knowledge and gain the latest insights to take with you to your first employer.
In this Master's programme, you choose one of the tracks. You will experience a combination of general courses and track-specific courses. You are allowed to switch tracks after you have started in the programme.
If your prior education does not (completely) fit the entry requirements, this pre-Master’s is your stepping stone to getting admitted to our Master's Accountancy and Control. The programme is designed to complement your prior education. It will help you to catch up on subjects such as quantitative (research) methods.
Are you looking for a quick introduction into the Master's Accountancy and Control? Watch our pitch video and get some great insights.
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• How can users rely on the information provided in financial reports? How do preparers of financial reports provide relevant information to users? These are the core questions in the Accountancy track.          




More about the track
• How can information help organisations reach their goals? This is the core question you will learn how to answer in the Control track.          




More about the track

pages.title: Facts and figures - Master's Finance - University of Amsterdam

pages.content:
[HEADING] Quantitative Finance (Finance)
[HEADING] Is Quantitative Finance for you?
[HEADING] Explore all Master's Finance tracks
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Do you want to model security prices and design complex strategies for a quantitative investment fund, using large-scale data analytics and state-of-the-art computing techniques? Do you want to help clients to develop proprietary risk-management strategies? Then the Quantitative Finance track is the one for you. This is one of the tracks you can opt for in our Master's in Finance.
Specialise in your field of interest
Lecturers leading in their field
Excellent career prospects
Top-ranked university
Compare this programme with our other programmes in the comparison overview. Click on the ♥️ icon of the programmes you want to compare. Analyse the different programmes to find the one that aligns with your interests and aspirations.
Quantitative Finance is one of the tracks you can opt for in our Master's in Finance. Take a look at the other tracks.
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• You want to gain expertise in quantitative tools and programming.
• You are interested in building quantitative models that calculate derivative prices, risk-adjusted performance of investment strategies, and risk exposure under regulatory regimes.
• You want to help develop the role of big data in finance.
• You aspire to use your analytical skills in your career. For example: in the stock market, in big data analysis, in management of risk and compliance functions and other disciplines.
• Asset Management
• Banking and Regulation
• Corporate Finance
• Real Estate Finance
• Finance and Real Estate Finance (combination track)
[GRID_TABLE]
Specialise in your field of interest








Learn more





       
                Alongside general courses of the Master's Finance, you take a course in computer programming applications to finance and electives of your choosing.
Lecturers leading in their field








Learn more





       
                You will be taught by experienced professors and industry experts. They will introduce you to state-of-the-art data analysis methods and finance research.
Excellent career prospects








Learn more





       
                You will have excellent job prospects in investment banking, hedge funds or other asset management firms with a quantitative-oriented strategy, and the FinTech sector.
Top-ranked university








Learn more





       
                The Amsterdam Business School belongs to the 1% of Business Schools in the world to hold the prestigious Triple Crown accreditation.

pages.title: Master's Quantitative Finance (Finance) - University of Amsterdam

pages.content:
[HEADING] Corporate Finance (Finance)
[HEADING] Is Corporate Finance for you?
[HEADING] Explore all Master's Finance tracks
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Do you want to consult companies about undertaking an acquisition or going public on the stock market? Do you want to work for a firm and help to manage its investment decisions and financing activities? Then the Corporate Finance track is the one for you. This is one of the tracks you can opt for in our Master's in Finance.
Specialise in your field of interest
Lecturers leading in their field
Excellent career prospects
Top-ranked university
Compare this programme with our other programmes in the comparison overview. Click on the ♥️ icon of the programmes you want to compare. Analyse the different programmes to find the one that aligns with your interests and aspirations.
Corporate Finance is one of the tracks you can opt for in our Master's in Finance. Take a look at the other tracks.
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• You want to learn how to estimate the value of firms, and of corporate actions like equity offerings or mergers and acquisitions.
• You would like to gain insight into how corporate value depends on their capital structure, terms of financing raised, quality of investment opportunities, and corporate governance.
• You aspire a career in corporate treasury departments, a consulting firm or investment banking divisions that advise companies, or venture capital funds. It also is a great track to prepare you in organising a start-up business model.
• You want to know how corporate governance practices affect sustainability, and debate whether firms should reward shareholders versus a broader set of stakeholders.
• Asset Management
• Banking and Regulation
• Quantitative Finance
• Real Estate Finance
• Finance and Real Estate Finance (combination track)
[GRID_TABLE]
Specialise in your field of interest








Learn more





       
                Alongside the general courses of the Master's Finance curriculum, you will take a course in corporate governance and electives of your choosing.
Lecturers leading in their field








Learn more





       
                You will be taught by experienced professors and industry experts. They will introduce you to state-of-the-art data analysis methods and finance research.
Excellent career prospects








Learn more





       
                You will have excellent job prospects at the advisory groups of investment banks, management consulting, corporate treasury, venture capital firms, and as start-up entrepreneurs.
Top-ranked university








Learn more





       
                The Amsterdam Business School belongs to the 1% of Business Schools in the world to hold the prestigious Triple Crown accreditation.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Application and admission
[HEADING] Enrolment for UvA Economics and Business students
[HEADING] Application process for students from outside UvA Economics and Business
[HEADING] For non-EU/EEA students with an international (non-Dutch) degree
[HEADING] For EU/EEA students with an international (non-Dutch) degree
[HEADING] For students with a Dutch degree
[HEADING] Cookie Consent
Students from UvA Economics and Business interested in progressing from a Bachelor’s programme to a Master’s, have their own entry requirements and step-by-step guide. For more details, visit the enrolment page for Bachelor's students or the enrolment page for pre-Master's students.
The application for the September 2025 intake is closed. We welcome you to apply to the September 2026 intake from October 2025.
These are the deadlines for the September 2025 start. Make sure to register in Studielink and submit your application in Embark before the deadline that applies to you.
1 June 2025 (or 1 April 2025 if you require a new Visa/Residence permit)
The entry requirements depend on where you have completed your prior education.
Your application starts in Studielink, the national registration system for students applying to a degree programme at a Dutch university.
Registering in Studielink is the first step before you can apply to your chosen programme. During registration, you need to select a specific track. If you are admitted to the programme, you will be accepted for the overall programme, not a specific track.
Please note: this is not an application to the Master's programme. Only after submitting your complete application in Embark (step 5) the Admissions Office will assess your eligibility to the programme.
After registering in Studielink, you will receive your UvAnetID. This will give you access to check the status of your personal enrolment checklist in SIS. There you find the next steps that you need to take in order to complete your enrolment.
In order to check if you are eligible for the programme you need to upload and submit your documents in Embark. Remember to keep track of the deadlines to ensure your application is submitted on time.
Your tuition fee needs to be credited to the UvA’s bank account 1 day before your degree programme starts at the latest, so 31 August for a September start.
If you have received the great news that you are (conditionally) admitted to the programme, it's time to focus on other essential matters like arranging a visa (if necessary), finding accommodation, and preparing for the start of your academic journey. We will inform you per email about these topics when (conditionally) admitted.
The UvA uses cookies to measure, optimise, and ensure the proper functioning of the website. Cookies are also placed in order to display third-party content and for marketing purposes. Click 'Accept' to agree to the placement of all cookies; if you only want to accept functional and analytical cookies, select ‘Decline’. You can change your preferences at any time by clicking on 'Cookie settings' at the bottom of each page. Also read the UvA Privacy statement.
• 1. Follow the deadlines
                        





These are the deadlines for the September 2025 start. Make sure to register in Studielink and submit your application in Embark before the deadline that applies to you.
For non-EU/EEA students with an international (non-Dutch) degree



You are applying for a scholarship
15 January 2025


You require a Visa and/or want to apply for UvA Housing
1 April 2025



For EU/EEA students with an international (non-Dutch) degree



You would like to apply for UvA Housing
1 April 2025


You do not want to apply for UvA Housing
1 May 2025



For students with a Dutch degree
1 June 2025 (or 1 April 2025 if you require a new Visa/Residence permit) 









More about visas and permits




More about scholarships




More about housing

• 2. Check the entry requirements (September 2025 intake)
                        





The entry requirements depend on where you have completed your prior education.

Applicants with an international degree
Applicants from another UvA faculty or Dutch university
Applicants from a Dutch University of Applied Sciences (HBO)
• Applicants with an international degree
• Applicants from another UvA faculty or Dutch university
• Applicants from a Dutch University of Applied Sciences (HBO)
• 3. Register in Studielink
                        





Your application starts in Studielink, the national registration system for students applying to a degree programme at a Dutch university.
Registering in Studielink is the first step before you can apply to your chosen programme. During registration, you need to select a specific track. If you are admitted to the programme, you will be accepted for the overall programme, not a specific track. 









Register in Studielink







Step-by-step guides and FAQs about Studielink













Please note: this is not an application to the Master's programme. Only after submitting your complete application in Embark (step 5) the Admissions Office will assess your eligibility to the programme.
• 4. Check your personal enrolment checklist in SIS
                        





After registering in Studielink, you will receive your UvAnetID. This will give you access to check the status of your personal enrolment checklist in SIS. There you find the next steps that you need to take in order to complete your enrolment.
• 5. Submit your online application in Embark
                        





In order to check if you are eligible for the programme you need to upload and submit your documents in Embark. Remember to keep track of the deadlines to ensure your application is submitted on time. 







More about submitting your application
• 6. Pay the tuition fee (after admission)
                        





Your tuition fee needs to be credited to the UvA’s bank account 1 day before your degree programme starts at the latest, so 31 August for a September start. 







More about paying the tuition fee








More about tuition fees and scholarships
• 7. Next Steps: Visa, Housing, Insurance, etc.
                        





If you have received the great news that you are (conditionally) admitted to the programme, it's time to focus on other essential matters like arranging a visa (if necessary), finding accommodation, and preparing for the start of your academic journey. We will inform you per email about these topics when (conditionally) admitted.
